2. In response to the appeal filed by ESL challenging the order of SEBI dated March 31, 2016, Securities Appellate Tribunal vide its order dated November 14, 2019 (the “Order”) upheld the order of SEBI and has imposed a penalty of ₹ 5 million on ESL and asked to make the payment within 30 days of the Order for alleged violation of Regulation 57(1) and Regulation 57(2)(a)(ii) of Securities and Exchange Board of India (Issue of Capital and Disclosure Requirements) Regulation, 2009. Vide a letter dated December 17, 2019, ESL made an application to SEBI requesting SEBI to not initiate recovery proceedings to recover the penalty, mentioning that the liability of penalty of ₹ 5 million is not payable by ESL to SEBI in terms of the approved resolution plan read with section 31(1) of Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2016 (“IBC”) and Section 238 of IBC. Till date no reply from SEBI has been received. The matter is still the same. ESL has not made payment of penalty of ₹ 5 million.
